results.title: Community
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Biology program; unit 1. Ecology”.
Defines the ecological community as a complex network of interrelationships among a group of plants and animals adapted to the same general physical conditions, food chains and food webs.

results.brief_description: This series documents Steinberg’s Limited of Montreal, major retailers, manufacturers and real estate operators well known in Ontario, Quebec.

results.title: International operations
results.creator_credit: Arthur Hammond and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Corporation”.
The arrival of Steinberg’s French affiliate, Supermarches Montreal, on the outskirts of Paris is viewed here from the point of its cultural effects: the impact of the supermarket on the shopping and eating habits of the French; and the problems of adjustment by store employees, by Paris shoppers, and by local merchants who see their customers drift away. As Sam Steinberg makes his first visit to the French stores, many of these problems are seen at first hand. Voice and narration by Arthur Hammond.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Arthur Hammond and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Growth
results.creator_credit: Arthur Hammond and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Corporation”.
A hand-cart and bicycle, then a delivery wagon and a horse - Sam Steinberg reminisces over the fifty years of his company’s growth into a large, diversified corporation. A company cannot stand still, it must go forward he claims. In this film you see the process continuing as corporation executives meet to consider interrelated operations, projects and priorities. Voice and narration by Arthur Hammond.

results.title: Bilingualism
results.creator_credit: Arthur Hammond and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Corporation”.
A close view of a wide-open management’s handling of a problem with parallels far beyond the borders of Quebec. How Steinberg Ltd comes to grips with one of the major challenges it faces - the bilingual, bicultural nature of the Quebec society in which it functions - is seen, as top and middle management pursue a policy on the issues. Voice and narration by Arthur Hammond.

results.title: Manyu-Wana
results.brief_description: Set among the red dirt, campfires, rock music and dreaming stories of an Aboriginal community in Central Australia, these programs were produced to help local children learn literacy and maths in their own language, Warlpiri. Scenes around the community, animation, puppet and magic characters are used to introduce letters, syllables, numbers and other maths concepts, and to illustrate story books. Traditional skills and activities are featured in segments on hunting and gathering bush foods, fire-making, traditional ceremonies and painting, and dreamtime stories about the landscape. An Aboriginal “Sesame Street”, this series of programs is suitable for use as a teaching/study resource for Primary, Secondary and Tertiary level students. In Warlpiri language with English subtitles.

results.title: Manyu-Wana 9
results.creator_credit: David Batty, Wendy Baarda and Warlpiri Media
results.brief_description:
Episode number 9 of Series “Manyu-Wana (A)”.
This episode covers the following topics: Cleaning up the house; words for ‘slow’ and ‘fast’; pram magic; reading “The Emu and the Crane”, a traditional story about how the emu lost its wings; working at the clinic; words for ‘North’, ‘South’, ‘East’ and ‘West’; song about making playing humpies in a creek bed; making spinifex resin; maths: 5-2=3, using eggs. Suitable for Primary, Secondary and Tertiary level students. In Warlpiri language with English subtitles.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Batty, Wendy Baarda and Warlpiri Media

results.title: Manyu-Wana 8
results.creator_credit: David Batty, Wendy Baarda and Warlpiri Media
results.brief_description:
Episode number 8 of Series “Manyu-Wana (A)”.
This episode covers the following topics: Planting trees; reading of “The Bird and the Snake”, a story from Willowra; words for ‘few’ and ‘many’, using children onn the Willowra school bus; tracking, spearing and cookking kangaroo; bathing, working at the butcher’s; numbers and counting; traditional-style dance about the Easter story; chips magic. Suitable for Primary, Secondary and Tertiary level students. In Warlpiri language with English subtitles.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Batty, Wendy Baarda and Warlpiri Media

results.title: Manyu-Wana 7
results.creator_credit: David Batty, Wendy Baarda and Warlpiri Media
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “Manyu-Wana (A)”.
This episodes covers the following topics: Magic story; school children at Willowra planting seeds for a vegetable garden; dog magic; reading of a dreamtime story, “The Crimson Cat, the Bird with a Red Breast”; words for ‘in’, ‘on’ and ‘under’; tracking a person by their footprints; song about children from local communities having fun; making a healthy stew; working at Nyirrpi store; basketball teams. Suitable for Primary, Secondary and tertiary level students. In Warlpiri language with English subtitles.
